phrases: Party is over
But I still want to dance
I cannot even sleep
Someday, one day my passion's fire will
From the beginning I knew
One day the flames would die out
Hey, I thought I did not need anything
But even now, I am so serious
Ah...
I still have time to make it
Ah... but I am going to burn it up, baby
Sorry darling, it is not that easy
But surely it is not that bad either
Give me fire
Light it up, baby.
I am going to burn it up, yeah
Party is over
Sorry darling Hurry up Ah... I still have time to make it
Sorry darling Hurry up Ah... I still have time to make it
Give me fire
Light it up, baby.
I am going to burn it up, yeah
5 The story of the Moriko Song, part 1
Hey!
Hyakkimaru.
Hey.
You okay?
Still too noisy for you, huh?
But it is so quiet here it creeps me out.
Sound.
It was the most shocking sense that Hyakkimaru had so far recovered.
It reverberated relentlessly in his head.
He knew not how to select which of the innumerable sounds to listen to.
Hyakkimaru drowned in the flood of sound.
Hey, maybe we should give up on going after the next monster.
The reward is handsome, but you are just not fit for it.
Is something there?
The bird monster!
It is huge!
Hyakkimaru, do not worry about the sound!
Your left!
Watch out!
Priest!
Oh, it was you two?
What a coincidence.
Hey, hey.
Come on, snap out of it.
What is wrong with you?
Hey...
I see, his ears eh?
Good for him.
It is not good.
He is gotten weaker now that he can hear.
How so?
I mean, he got beat up by that ghoul that even you could kill.
Well, thank you.
He will be all right, will not he?
He is gotten past the worst of it.
We could use some medicine, if only we had any.
I will go run and find some.
There is a big town across the river.
You better not.
I heard there is a war brewing.
It is dangerous.
Seems like the Sakai clan, who rules this area, betrayed an ally.
The 2 armies have their swords drawn.
For strangers like us to go near them now would be suicidal.
That is why I turned back and came across you two.
Dang it, why do samurai like to fight so much?
Sorry, that was too loud, huh.
Do not move, now.
Your wounds will open up.
Dear, dear.
You are like a wounded beast hiding in his cave.
Hear this?
This is a human's voice.
The other sounds are the creatures in the woods, the fire, and the wind.
You have to get used to it.
To come out of your cave and live in this world.
Hyakkimaru.
He is hurt.
Do not force him like that.
He needs time to get used to it.
What a gentle voice.
You should not get up yet.
Dear, dear.
I cannot eat this tough meat.
Oh, the red flower
In her hair
It blooms and sways
Like the sun...
Are you hurt?
Are you okay?
Oh, you cannot see.
See?
I am right here.
What is wrong?
You must have a fever.
You should not be in the water.
Come.
Oh no, hang on there.
Hey!
I have never seen him so weak before.
It must be because of his wounds.
But he is also regained many things from the demons.
Maybe he is having trouble adjusting.
Here are some old rags, but they are clean.
-Thanks.
-Mio, was it?
Forgive us for causing you so much trouble.
Not at all.
Please stay until he is better.
Can we?
Of course.
There are lots of people here like your big brother.
We are all used to it.
Do not be shy, say hello kids.
There was a terrible war.
We lost our houses and everything we had.
So we all live together here.
So none of them have dads or moms?
Right.
But they are all wonderful children.
We make do somehow, even though they are all young.
Sis Mio, you are still up?
Come out, out you guys.
Sis Mio, you better get some sleep while you can.
I will watch over the hurt guy, so you go to sleep.
Okay, okay.
If you need anything, ask Takebo here.
Hurry up.
I made breakfast so eat it before you sleep.
I will, I will.
There is some for you guys, too.
Potato gruel.
Eat up.
T-Thanks.
You need help?
Nah, you watch over your guy.
I cannot just sit here and do nothing in return.
At least let me work for how much you feed us.
You are a good guy, huh.
Even though you cried like a baby over your guy.
I did not!
Not even a drop.
Shh, you will wake Sis Mio.
Sorry, but why is she sleeping now?
Because she works during the night.
The Sakai army cannot say when the war might start up.
So somebody has to serve them all through the night.
Besides, the pay is better during the night.
Sis Mio works hard, so she even gets food.
So we have to let her sleep during the day.
You are a pretty good guy too, huh.
Where are you off to, Priest?
I am going to look for a path where we can avoid the battlefield.
I will not be gone long.
But if I do not return, it means I have found some little path to sneak out of.
Okay.
Huh?
He is not with you guys?
We just meet sometimes.
He is weird.
I wonder if there is going to be another war.
Who knows?
I guess we cannot stay here either.
Damn.
Sakai's army at the border has not made a move.
It is a deadlock.
If this lasts any longer, we will have to send more provisions.
We must have enough for that.
Yes, but...
It has not rained for almost a month now.
It is uncommon to be so dry during this season.
We should store up, just in case.
There will be no bad harvests on my land.
Sir...
How can you be so sure?
My lady.
Trouble with Lord Sakai, and now this drought.
We had a landslide this year, too.
It is like we have gone back to the past.
What are you saying?
You, I, this domain.
We all sit atop a small cornerstone.
Please do not forget that.
It could crumble and fall any day.
The hell with Sakai.
-Take care of matters quickly.
-Yes, my lord.
Go, go, go!
Swish, swish!
Kids.
Stop giggling and help out.
Hyakkimaru, how are you feeling?
You still have a fever.
I will get you some medicine tonight.
I am sure Lord Sakai's army has some.
I will be going to work then.
Supper will be ready in a bit.
Pick a red flower
To give to her
In her hair
You...
You creatures know the safe paths better than us humans.
This way, then.
This is quite a nice place.
What are you doing out here?
Medicine?
Do not worry, here.
I will brew it for you.
How strange.
It feels like you can see.
Down deep inside of me.
He can.
He sees the color of your soul.
Do not you leave like that.
You scared me.
Color of the soul?
Yeah, I do not get it very much either.
But he can see the colors of the souls of living things.
Not just people.
Grass, trees, animals.
He can find ghouls easily, too.
I bet they have got a really gross color.
I see...
What?
Maybe he wants to hear you sing.
Sing?
Seems like your song does not bother him.
Hey!
If he listens to you sing, he will get used to sound.
He is like a hurt beast in a cave right now.
Draw him out of it with your song.
My song is not that great...
Okay then.
Pick a red flower
To give to her
In her hair
I will put the flower
Oh, the priest.
No paths out?
Nah, I have some good news and some bad news.
Sound like a great place!
You will be safe there even if a war starts.
I licked the soil, and it seemed good.
Let us go, Sis Mio.
Let us live there.
Yes...
But not so fast.
Something already owns that land.
But you said it was a vacant lot.
A demon.
It is not something we want to mess with lightly.
Aww, man.
You mean, a ghoul?
It is way stronger than just any old ghoul.
I see.
Hey, you are not going out there to get it, are you?
Wait, you cannot with that injury.
Priest!
Though I told you knowing you would go there,
I did not think you would go before your wounds are healed.
You just cannot wait, huh?
Priest, take care of him for me!
I will try harder, too.
We really must watch over him.
You are going to work for the enemy, too?
You mean, you are going to work for both sides?
Yes, starting tonight.
That is too dangerous.
Yeah, it is hard enough on you already.
But we need to get ready to move to the new place.
We cannot live on an empty lot.
Yeah, but...
Do not worry.
War took a lot from us, so let us get it back.
Sis Mio...
I should rest up while I can.
Goodnight, then.
Yeah.
Sis Mio's really stubborn when she wants to be.
But I heard the enemy is pretty rough.
Okay, I will go with her.
You?
Then I will go too.
No, you must stay with the other kids.
Do not worry, if things get too tough, I will make her quit.
Okay, thanks.
Take them back from war, huh.
I like that.
We will take from the samurai, too.
How long are we going to sit here?
I cannot make a name for myself.
Yeah, nothing to do here but take a dump.
Sirs.
I am looking for a job.
Huh?
Where did Mio go?
You see?
You sure about this?
You should wait until you have healed.
That must be it.
Now!
Hyakkimaru!
Hyakkimaru, your voice...!
Sorrow scatters in the wind,
piling up to form shadows
Our footsteps admonish indifference in such verbose ways
As I peek into your fathomless eyes, I lose my composure
Is there any hope in the place I am heading to?
I feign amusement and laugh
because this road is so dark
I will be there to shine the light
I am used to playing at saying goodbye,
but I cried when I waved to you
Our fiery woes fade... and fade... until night falls upon us
If I knew tomorrow would be so mundane,
I would not have said that I wanted to live
I know it is futile but cannot help dreaming of a future... a future... you are to blame
Yocho
